feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 1:53PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf From The Bering Strait to Point Hope Through Monday... Northwest winds of 15 to 30 mph are expected to develop tonight over the southern Chukchi Sea continue into Monday. This will cause elevated surf with minor beach erosion along the coast from the Bering Strait to Point Hope.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:18AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..Elevated Surf From Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow Through Monday Night... Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph blowing over the Arctic Coast from Cape Lisburne to Point Barrow are causing elevated surf. These winds will continue into Monday, then turn northwest Monday afternoon, and decrease Monday night. These winds are causing
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Flood Warning issued August 12 at 10:27AM CDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Cache River Near Patterson affecting Jackson and Woodruff Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 3:00PM MST until August 12 at 4:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE AREA EAST OF CROWN KING IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 255 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. A stream gauge on Black Canyon Creek showed a 3 foot rise. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 2:59PM MST until August 12 at 3:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 300 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR MASSACHUSETTS... A dry airmass combined with severe to extreme drought conditions will result in elevated fire weather concerns today. entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued August 12 at 10:58AM PDT until August 13 at 1:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THUNDERSTORMS WITH ABUNDANT LIGHTNING TODAY AND TONIGHT... Thunderstorms will develop through the day today into tonight ahead of an ejecting low pressure trough moving onshore off of the eastern Pacific. Storms will be a mix of wet and dry and contain frequent lightning that may result in new fire starts. Some storms may become strong or severe with strong outflow winds and large
entry.cap:areaDesc: East Portion of North Cascades National Park, Lake Chelan National Recreation Area; East Washington North Cascades; Methow Valley; Okanogan Valley; Waterville Plateau

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 12 at 2:57PM CDT until August 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life threatening waves of 3 to 5 feet and dangerous currents are expected. * WHERE...Beaches along Lake Michigan in Sheboygan, and Ozaukee counties.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected along portions of Kirby Creek in far Southeast Hot Springs County. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT.

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
